    This program provides:

    - Regressive or psychotic behavior
    - Anger or rage episodes
    - Oppositional defiant behaviors
    - Suicidal threats/attempts
    - Domestic violence
    - Runaway episodes
    - Family conflicts
    - Depression and anxiety
    - Low motivation
    - Grief, loss, and abandonment
    - Trauma responses
    - Sexual abuse/assault
    - Drug/alcohol use
    - Poor attention span and hyperactivity
    - Poor self-image or identity problems
    - School problems/truancy

    Loma Linda University Health has contracts with many insurance companies and accepts most state and federal funding including Medicare and Medi-Cal. To help meet the needs of the patients, this service is committed to providing access to financial programs when patients are uninsured or underinsured and may need assistance in paying their healthcare bill.   • Mental Health Urgent Care

    by  RI International - Riverside County
    Skip to next program
      Reviewed on: 11/14/2024
    Work here? Claim!
    The Mental Health Urgent Cares provide individualized support for adults experiencing mental health challenges. Staffed by a competent, caring team, a safe, supportive, recovery-oriented...
    Main Services
    • mental health evaluation
    • prevent & treat
    • medications for mental health
    Other Services

    Next Steps:

    Contact or go to the nearest location
    Call 951-509-2499
    8.47 miles ( serves your local area)
    9890 County Farm Road, Riverside, CA 92503
    Open Now : Open 24 Hours
    Print View
    Eligibility:
    • This program helps people who are older than 18 years old.
    • Must be voluntarily seeking assistance in a crisis situation.
    • Must have Medicare or Medi-Cal.
    Availability:
    available
    Description:
    The Mental Health Urgent Cares provide individualized support for adults experiencing mental health challenges. Staffed by a competent, caring team, a safe, supportive, recovery-oriented environment is provided, with an emphasis placed on safety, the reduction of symptoms, and the creation of a plan for continuing support and services.

    Services Include:

    - Mental health screening and assessment services
    - Medications to address the needs of those in crisis
    - Safe, efficient, trauma-informed, and least-restrictive setting
    - Timely discharge planning
    - Individualized services and supports
    - Peer Support
    - Psychiatric and medication support
    - Recovery education
    - Nutritional education
    - Health and recreation
    - Community coordination
    - Follow-up

    RI International – Riverside County has two 24/7 Mental Health Urgent Care Centers open. The Centers provides individualized support for adults experiencing mental health challenges in a supportive recovery-oriented environment. Needs and circumstances determine the length of time each guest spends at the Mental Health Urgent Care.

    Guests able to walk-in, or to be referred by mobile crisis teams or law enforcement for crisis and assessment services. Accepts Medicare, Medi-Cal, all major insurance. However, payment is not required to receive services. Visit in person for services or call for more information.
    Languages:
    English
    Cost:
    Reduced Cost

    by  Riverside University Health System - Behavioral Health (RUHS-BH)
    Skip to next program
      Reviewed on: 11/07/2024
    Work here? Claim!
    The Mental Health Urgent Care provides individualized support 24/7 for adults experiencing mental health challenges.This program provides:- Urgent care mental health screening and assessment...

    Call 951-509-2499 (your nearest location)
    8.59 miles ( serves your local area)
    9990 County Farm Road, Riverside, CA 92503
    Open Now : Open 24 Hours
    Print View
    Eligibility:
    • This program helps people who are older than 17 years old.
    • This program serves those who have been diagnosed with a mental illness, who is experiencing a mental health crisis, and may also have a co-occurring substance use disorder.
    • This program serves Riverside County residents.
    Availability:
    available
    Description:
    The Mental Health Urgent Care provides individualized support 24/7 for adults experiencing mental health challenges.

    This program provides:

    - Urgent care mental health screening and assessment services
    - Medications for mental health
    - Timely transition (discharge) planning

    The program offers a variety of services customized to the needs and preferences of guests, including:

    - Peer support
    - Recovery education
    - Nutritional education
    - Health and recreation
    - Community coordination and follow-up

    There is no cost to receive services. Guests able to walk-in, or to be referred by mobile crisis teams or law enforcement for crisis and assessment services.

    Needs and circumstances determine the length of time each guest spends at the Mental Health Urgent Care. Guest stays cannot exceed 23-hours, as mutually agreed upon with staff. Upon a guest’s arrival, we begin actively working on solutions.
    Languages:
    English, Spanish
    Cost:
    Free

    Description:
    Emergency Treatment Services (ETS) provides psychiatric emergency services 24 hours a day, 7 days a week for all ages. Consumers may be referred to the Inpatient Treatment Facility (ITF) or other private hospitals.

    This program provides:

    - Evaluation
    - Crisis intervention
    - Referrals for psychiatric hospitalization, as needed for adults, children, and adolescents
